alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Martin, east central Morgan, Johnson, northern Knott, Floyd, eastern Breathitt and Magoffin Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Relief to Elmrock. Movement was moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elna, Redbush, Relief, Gillem Branch, Win, Hargis and Niles around 320 PM EDT. Barnrock and Soft Shell around 325 PM EDT. Flatgap and Barnetts Creek around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bolyn, Winifred, Handshoe, Kerz, Larkslane, Mid, Gunlock, Staffordsville, Paintsville, Chandlerville, Sip, Mousie, Galen, Hippo, Wittensville, Pyramid, Estill, Betty, Porter Junction, Garret, Bosco, Stambaugh, Nippa, Hueysville, Tutor Key, Wayland, Glo, Demo, Raven, Eastern, Offutt, Minnie, Hunter, Price, Langley, Whitehouse, River and Alphoretta. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 72 and 76. Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County near mile marker 2, and between mile markers 10 and 20. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan
